senses.ex: She had to adhere the label to the box.

Tips.title: Literal Sticking
Tips.description: Used for describing a physical attachment of objects, like glue sticking things together.
Tips.example: The stickers must adhere to the notebook cover firmly.

Tips.title: Not Always Permanent
Tips.description: In this context, the attachment might be temporary, like a magnet adheres to a fridge.
Tips.example: Post-it notes are designed to adhere to surfaces temporarily.

senses.de: to follow or obey a rule, instruction, etc.
senses.ex: It's important to adhere to the guidelines for the project to be successful.

Tips.title: Obligation Sense
Tips.description: Conveys a sense of responsibility or duty to follow certain procedures or norms.
Tips.example: Employees must adhere to the dress code on weekdays.

Tips.title: Formality
Tips.description: Often used in formal contexts, such as legal, academic, or safety-related situations.
Tips.example: The lab requires all researchers to adhere to safety protocols.

Tips.title: Serious Consequences
Tips.description: Not adhering to official rules or guidelines may lead to serious consequences or penalties.
Tips.example: Failing to adhere to the court order can result in a fine.

senses.de: to support or maintain a particular belief, policy, attitude, etc.
senses.ex: He adheres to a strict vegetarian diet.

Tips.title: Strong Commitment
Tips.description: Shows a strong commitment or dedication to a cause, philosophy, or lifestyle.
Tips.example: They strictly adhere to the philosophy of non-violence.

Tips.title: Consistency
Tips.description: Reflects consistency in actions and beliefs over time, not just a one-time occurrence.
Tips.example: Even abroad, she adheres to her cultural traditions.
